definition: to stick closely to (a topic or theme etc)
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code

sentences.english: A blocked vent had caused the tank to buckle.
sentences.chinese: 有一条封闭的管子使罐子紧扣。

sentences.english: Your wandering eyes pull at your lover’s heartstrings.
sentences.chinese: 你迷离的眼睛紧扣爱人的心弦。

sentences.english: Others may see doors open that lead them to financial success that were previously closed.
sentences.chinese: 而其他人会看到以前紧扣的经济成功之门向他们敞开。

sentences.english: If it’s going to attack, lie facedown, with your hands clasped behind your neck.
sentences.chinese: 如果它要袭击你，面朝下躺下，双手在颈后紧扣。

sentences.english: The speech he made stuck to the key points.
sentences.chinese: 他所作的演说紧扣要点，没有多余的话。

sentences.english: Your theme should be content-focused and really simple;
sentences.chinese: 你的主题模版必须紧扣内容，同时简约优雅。

sentences.english: The poet's fingers by the end of Lycidas aren't forced or rude.
sentences.chinese: 在的最后，诗人的手指并没有紧扣着。

sentences.english: Joseph clasped his hands and let them hang loosely between his knees.
sentences.chinese: 约瑟夫两手紧扣，垂在两膝之间。

sentences.english: These four aspects are closely connected, making up the organic entirety of Mengzi s virtue theory.
sentences.chinese: 这四个方面环环紧扣，构成了孟子德性论的有机整体。

sentences.english: The system consists alloy ground floor extrusions and interlocking cassette boards.
sentences.chinese: 该系统由铝合金型材，环环紧扣地下磁带板。

sentences.english: The translation follows closely the original.
Remember, your boss is busy so stick to the point.
sentences.chinese: 记住，你的上司很忙，所以要紧扣要点。

definition: to put effort into sth/to try really hard
to revolve around/to center on (an issue)
to hit the target (esp. in argument)/to strike home
Four Comprehensives (political guidelines announced by President Xi Jinping, 2015)
an overall plan taking into account all factors
arteries and veins/network of blood vessels/vascular system (of a plant or animal)/(fig.) fabric (i.e. underlying structure, as in "social fabric")/overall context
